resources.string: Enable this to set the port manually every time you connect.

This app can stream audio from your linux PC using PulseAudio(a sound system which makes Linux PCs capable of playing audio) and also make your device act as a microphone for your PC.

To stream audio or record audio, first enable the PulseAudio module by running the shell script(called pashare) provided along with the app.(Download it from this website if you don\'t have it)

Next, go back to the main view of this app and enter your computer\'s local IP address. As it is assumed that you will be using the shell script from my repository, the default port to connect to is set to 8000. But, if you want to connect via some other port for any reason, you can change the port the script uses by opening pashare script in a text editor and editing the port argument and set the default port used to the same port number in the app settings.

After entering the IP address, click on the play button or the mic button to play or record audio respectively.

To stop streaming or recording audio, press the stop button.

If for some reason, you want to set the port number manually every time you connect to the audio server(the computer streaming the audio), enable the "Set Port Manually" option in the app settings.

Normally, dark mode is set to be the default one but if you want to use light mode or make the app follow system\'s dark mode settings or enable dark mode only when battery saver is on, change the dark mode setting in the app settings.
